thread.title: Jimmy Fallon imagines a Trump-approved ‘New York Times’ commercial
thread.title_full: Jimmy Fallon imagines a Trump-approved ‘New York Times’ commercial

author: Oliver Gettell
title: Jimmy Fallon imagines a Trump-approved ‘New York Times’ commercial

organizations.name: getty images  the new york times

text:
Email Andrew Lipovsky/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images 
The New York Times unveiled a splashy new ad campaign this week — complete with an Oscars commercial — that emphasizes the importance of hard-hitting journalism. Now thanks to Jimmy Fallon, we have an idea of what President Trump’s version of the campaign would look like. 
On Friday’s episode of The Tonight Show , Fallon presented a faux Times commercial that Trump ostensibly made a few edits to. 
“In today’s world, journalism is more important than ever,” a narrator says over stock footage of busy printing presses. “And the New York Times is your source for top-notch reporting each and every day.” 
Right on cue, a clip of Trump cuts in and blurts, “Wrong!” 
“Our reporters won’t rest until they deliver the truth right to your front door,” the commercial says. 
“Fake news!” Trump counters. See who gets the last word in the video below. #FallonTonight Sneak Peek: Donald Trump might have meddled with newly released NY Times commercial pic.twitter.com/Q24R9bDfuk 
— Fallon Tonight (@FallonTonight) February 25, 2017 
The Tonight Show airs weeknights at 11:35 p.m. ET on NBC. Show Full Article
